001package net.tvburger.jdl.linalg;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.Array;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
005
006public class TypedVector<N extends Number> implements Vector<N> {
007
008    private final Array<N> values;
009    private final boolean columnVector;
010    private final JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport;
011
012    public TypedVector(Array<N> values, boolean columnVector, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport) {
013        this.values = values;
014        this.columnVector = columnVector;
015        this.typeSupport = typeSupport;
016    }
017
018    @Override
019    public int getDimensions() {
020        return values.length();
021    }
022
023    @Override
024    public boolean isColumnVector() {
025        return columnVector;
026    }
027
028    @Override
029    public TypedVector<N> transpose() {
030        return new TypedVector<>(values, !columnVector, typeSupport);
031    }
032
033    @Override
034    public TypedMatrix<N> asMatrix() {
035        N[][] matrixValues;
036        if (columnVector) {
037            matrixValues = typeSupport.createArrayOfArrays(values.length(), 1);
038            for (int i = 0; i < values.length(); i++) {
039                matrixValues[i][0] = values.get(i);
040            }
041        } else {
042            matrixValues = typeSupport.createArrayOfArrays(1, values.length());
043            for (int i = 0; i < values.length(); i++) {
044                matrixValues[0][i] = values.get(i);
045            }
046        }
047        return new TypedMatrix<>(matrixValues, typeSupport);
048    }
049
050    @Override
051    public Array<N> asArray() {
052        return values;
053    }
054
055    @Override
056    public N get(int i) {
057        return values.get(i - 1);
058    }
059
060    @Override
061    public TypedVector<N> multiply(N value) {
062        return new TypedVector<>(values.clone().apply(n -> typeSupport.multiply(n, value)), columnVector, typeSupport);
063    }
064
065    @Override
066    public Vector<N> divide(N value) {
067        return new TypedVector<>(values.clone().apply(n -> typeSupport.divide(n, value)), columnVector, typeSupport);
068    }
069
070    @Override
071    public TypedVector<N> add(N value) {
072        return new TypedVector<>(values.clone().apply(n -> typeSupport.add(n, value)), columnVector, typeSupport);
073    }
074
075    @Override
076    public TypedVector<N> subtract(N value) {
077        return add(typeSupport.negate(value));
078    }
079
080    @Override
081    public TypedVector<N> add(Vector<N> vector) {
082        Array<N> addedValues = values.clone();
083        for (int i = 0; i < values.length(); i++) {
084            addedValues.set(i, typeSupport.add(values.get(i), vector.get(i + 1)));
085        }
086        return new TypedVector<>(addedValues, columnVector, typeSupport);
087    }
088
089    @Override
090    public TypedVector<N> subtract(Vector<N> vector) {
091        return add(vector.multiply(typeSupport.minusOne()));
092    }
093
094    @Override
095    public N dotProduct(Vector<N> vector) {
096        N result = typeSupport.zero();
097        if (vector.getDimensions() != getDimensions()) {
098            throw new IllegalArgumentException();
099        }
100        for (int i = 0; i < values.length(); i++) {
101            result = typeSupport.add(result, typeSupport.multiply(values.get(i), vector.get(i + 1)));
102        }
103        return result;
104    }
105
106    @Override
107    public N norm() {
108        N result = typeSupport.zero();
109        for (N value : values) {
110            result = typeSupport.add(result, typeSupport.multiply(value, value));
111        }
112        return typeSupport.squareRoot(result);
113    }
114
115    @Override
116    public int hashCode() {
117        return values.hashCode() * (columnVector ? -1 : 1);
118    }
119
120    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
121    @Override
122    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
123        if (obj == this) {
124            return true;
125        }
126        if (obj instanceof TypedVector<?> v) {
127            return columnVector == v.columnVector && Array.equals(values, (Array<N>) v.values, typeSupport);
128        } else {
129            return false;
130        }
131    }
132
133    @Override
134    public void print() {
135        print(null);
136    }
137
138    @Override
139    public void print(String name) {
140        asMatrix().print(name);
141    }
142
143    @Override
144    public JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> getNumberTypeSupport() {
145        return typeSupport;
146    }
147}
